Package org.forgerock.openam.upgrade.steps

Class UpgradeServerDefaultsStep

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openam.upgrade.steps.AbstractUpgradeStep
      • org.forgerock.openam.upgrade.steps.UpgradeServerDefaultsStep
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UpgradeStep
    public class UpgradeServerDefaultsStep
extends AbstractUpgradeStep
    Detects changes made to default server properties and upgrades them if required.

      Only include in the list of modified attributes those that are listed in the serverupgrade.properites file; otherwise existing properties that have been locally modified would be over-written.

        Description copied from interface: UpgradeStep

        Returns:
        true if this upgrade step needs to be performed.

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
                throws UpgradeException
        Description copied from interface: UpgradeStep
        Initializes the upgrade step during which it determines what sort of changes needs to be applied to the configurationif any.
        Throws:
        UpgradeException - If there was an error while determining the required changes.

      • calculateAddedServerDefaults

        protected Map<String,​String> calculateAddedServerDefaults​(Map<String,​String> newDefaults,
                                                                Map<String,​String> existingDefaults)
        Finds newly added default server properties.
        Parameters:
        newDefaults - The default server properties defined in the new version.
        existingDefaults - The default server properties defined in the current version.
        Returns:
        The newly added properties.

      • calculateModifiedServerDefaults

        protected Map<String,​String> calculateModifiedServerDefaults​(Map<String,​String> newDefaults,
                                                                   Map<String,​String> existingDefaults,
                                                                   Set<String> attrToModify)
        Only include in the list of modified attributes those that are listed in the serverupgrade.properites file; otherwise existing properties that have been locally modified would be over-written.
        Parameters:
        newDefaults - The default server properties defined in the new version.
        existingDefaults - The default server properties defined in the current version.
        attrToModify - Attributes that should be checked for modification.
        Returns:
        Modified key value pairs.

      • calculateDeletedServerDefaults

        protected Set<String> calculateDeletedServerDefaults​(Map<String,​String> existingDefaults,
                                                     Map<String,​String> validServerProperties)
        Finds deleted attributes by comparing the currently defined properties against the new valid server properties. By comparing against the valid server properties we can ensure that manually defined custom properties will not be removed.
        Parameters:
        existingDefaults - The currently defined default server properties.
        validServerProperties - The valid server properties defined in validserverconfig.properties.
        Returns:
        The attributenames that are no longer valid.

      • perform

        public void perform()
             throws UpgradeException
        Description copied from interface: UpgradeStep
        Performs the required changes for this upgrade step.
        Throws:
        UpgradeException - If there was an error while upgrading the configuration.

        public String getShortReport​(String delimiter)
        Description copied from interface: UpgradeStep
        Returns a short report for this upgrade step that should be suitable for the upgrade screen.
        Parameters:
        delimiter - The delimiter to use between lines.
        Returns:
        The short upgrade report.
